channel.title: Trying to run "sudo apt-get update" in docker container ,but do not have password for redash
channel.description:
I want to install some app in docker container(redash/redash:8.0.0.b32245) ,so run"sudo apt-get update", ,but do not have password for redash(or root)？ thanks！ --------------------------------------------------------- We trust you have received the usual lecture from the local System Administrator. It usually boils down to these three things:
#1) Respect the privacy of others. #2) Think before you type. #3) With great power comes great responsibility.
[sudo] password for redash: ----------------------------------------------------------------------

item.title: Trying to run "sudo apt-get update" in docker container ,but do not have password for redash
item.dc:creator: mzhalbyr
item.description:
How did you resolve your problem?
I have the same problem when i try to restart redash process by sudo supervisorctl restart all

Read full topic

item.title: Trying to run "sudo apt-get update" in docker container ,but do not have password for redash

item.source: Trying to run "sudo apt-get update" in docker container ,but do not have password for redash

item.title: Trying to run "sudo apt-get update" in docker container ,but do not have password for redash
item.dc:creator: jesse
item.description:
I don’t think our Docker configuration specifies a password for the Redash user. The “Docker” way to do what you describe is add whatever commands you would like to run to the Dockerfile itself and then rebuild the container.

Read full topic
